title: Authors and Citation
text: Aeschbach S, Wulff DU (2023). associatoR: Analyzing association data. R package version 0.1.0, https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=associatoR.
code: @Manual{,   title = {associatoR: Analyzing association data},   author = {Samuel Aeschbach and Dirk U. Wulff},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=associatoR}, }

title: Analyzing association data
text: Associations offer window semantics mind, revealing concepts words interconnected. interesting applications psychological theory also practical uses marketing research, sociology, education, artificial intelligence. associatoR R package work association data. offers pipelines import, normalize, process, analyze, convey results.

title: Analyzing association data
text: associatoR package developed Samuel Aeschbach Dirk U. Wulff.

title: Analyzing association data
text: latest development version GitHub can installed via devtools::install_github("samuelae/associatoR"). Note requires prior installation devtools package can achieved running install.packages("devtools") R.

title: Analyzing association data
text: prototypical workflow using functions associatoR package. Detailed descriptions can found package website. includes function reference.
code: data %>%    ar_import(...) %>%    ar_set_target(...) %>%    ar_embed(...) %>%    ar_plot(...)

title: Characterize targets using external lookup-table — ar_characterize_targets

title: Characterize targets using external lookup-table — ar_characterize_targets
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated ar_import. characteristic character string vector specifying word characteristics add targets. Must one multiple c("valence", "frequency", "pos", "concreteness").

title: Characterize targets using external lookup-table — ar_characterize_targets
text: Returns associatoR object containing list tibbles, targets gaining additional columns including target characteristics: participants tibble participants including participant id potential participant attributes. cues tibble cues including cue variable potential cue attributes. responses tibble responses including participant id, cues, responses, response level, additional response attributes. targets tibble targets including specified analysis target, word characteristics

text: Append response frequency target targets table associatoR object.

code: ar_count_targets(associations, ...)

title: Count target occurences in responses — ar_count_targets
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated ar_import. ... optional logical comparisons filtering responses computing frequencies.

title: Count target occurences in responses — ar_count_targets
text: Returns associatoR object containing list tibbles, targets gaining frequency column: participants tibble participants including participant id potential participant attributes. cues tibble cues including cue variable potential cue attributes. responses tibble responses including participant id, cues, responses, response level, additional response attributes. targets tibble targets including specified analysis target

title: Count target occurences in responses — ar_count_targets
code: ar_import(ai_asso, participant = "id",           response = "association_correct",           cue_manual = "AI",           participant_vars = c("age", "gender", "use", "expertise"),           response_vars = c("association", "trial")) %>%   ar_normalize() %>%   ar_set_targets(target_set = "responses") #>  #> ── An associatoR object ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  #> participants #> # A tibble: 500 × 5 #>      id   age gender   use expertise #>   <int> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl> #> 1     1    42      1     3         1 #> 2     3    54      1     9        10 #> 3     4    46      1     4         2 #> 4     5    53      2     8         7 #> 5     7    52      2     3         7 #> # ℹ 495 more rows #>  #> cues #> # A tibble: 1 × 1 #>   cue   #>   <chr> #> 1 AI    #>  #> responses #> # A tibble: 2,500 × 5 #>      id cue   response         association      trial #>   <int> <chr> <chr>            <chr>            <dbl> #> 1     1 AI    robot            Robot                1 #> 2     1 AI    google           Google               2 #> 3     1 AI    bing             Bing                 3 #> 4     1 AI    power to control Power to control     4 #> 5     1 AI    smart            Smart                5 #> # ℹ 2,495 more rows #>  #> targets #> # A tibble: 1,129 × 1 #>   target           #>   <chr>            #> 1 robot            #> 2 google           #> 3 bing             #> 4 power to control #> 5 smart            #> # ℹ 1,124 more rows #>

title: Embed associations — ar_embed
text: ar_embed_targets generates target embeddings

title: Embed associations — ar_embed
code: ar_embed(   data,   type = "ppmi-svd",   min_count = 5,   n_dim = 300,   model = NULL,   token = NULL,   context = NULL )

title: Embed associations — ar_embed
text: data ar_object including targets. type character specifying type embedding. One c("counts","ppmi","ppmi-svd","huggingface"). Default "ppmi-svd". min_count integer value specifying minimum response count responses considered embedding type = c("counts","ppmi","ppmi-svd"). Default 5. n_dim integer value specifying number dimensions generated type = "ppmi-svd". Default 300. model character specifying model label. Must match name huggingface.co/models. token character string specifying access token hugging face API. Must obtained huggingface.co/inference-api. context optional character string specifying common lead text may help language model interpret associations. Defaults "Free association: "

title: Embed associations — ar_embed
text: function returns associatoR object including new  matrix element called target_embeddings containing target embeddings.

title: Embed associations — ar_embed
text: Aeschbach, S., Mata, R., Wulff, D. U. (2024). associatoR. psyArXiv

title: Import association data — ar_import
text: ar_import processes tabular association data associatoR object.

title: Import association data — ar_import
code: ar_import(   data,   participant,   cue = NULL,   cue_manual = NULL,   response,   participant_vars = NULL,   cue_vars = NULL,   response_vars = NULL,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Import association data — ar_import
text: data data.frame tibble containing association data. participant character string variable name data identifying participants. cue character string variable name data identifying cues. cue_manual optional character string specifying cue responses. Overrides argument cue. response character string variable name data identifying responses. participant_vars optional character vector containing additional variable names data attributes participants. cue_vars optional character vector containing additional variable names data attributes cues. response_vars optional character vector containing additional variable names data attributes responses verbose logical specifying whether show messages.

title: Import association data — ar_import
text: Returns associatoR object containing list tibbles: participants tibble participants including participant id potential participant attributes. cues tibble cues including cue variable potential cue attributes. responses tibble responses including participant id, cues, responses, response level, additional response attributes.

title: Import association data — ar_import
text: Aeschbach, S., Mata, R., Wulff, D. U. (progress)

title: Import association data — ar_import
code: ai_asso_imported <- ar_import(ai_asso,                               participant = "id",                               response = "association_correct",                               cue_manual = "AI",                               participant_vars = c("age", "gender", "use", "expertise"),                               response_vars = c("association", "trial"))

title: Normalize responses — ar_normalize
text: ar_normalize performs normalization steps responses (cues) wraps around ar_normalize_manual.

title: Normalize responses — ar_normalize
code: ar_normalize(   associations,   case = "lower",   punct = "end",   punct_replacement = " ",   whitespace = "squish" )

title: Normalize responses — ar_normalize
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated ar_import. case character specifying normalization cases. Must one c("lower", "upper", "sentence"). Setting case = "lower" normalizes responses lower case, case = "lower" upper case, case = "sentence" sentence case. punct character specifying normalization punctuation. Must one c("end", ""). punct = "end" replaces punctuation end (including following whitespaces) punct_replacement (default single white space). punct = "" replaces punctuation. punct_replacement character used replacement punctuation. whitespace character specifying normalization white spaces. Must one c("squish", "trim"). Setting whitespace = "squish" removes additional white spaces start, end, -words, whereas setting whitespace = "trim" removes white space start end.

title: Normalize responses — ar_normalize
text: Returns associatoR object containing list tibbles: participants tibble participants including participant id potential participant attributes. cues tibble cues including cue variable potential cue attributes. responses tibble responses including participant id, cues, responses, response level, additional response attributes.

title: Normalize responses — ar_normalize
text: Aeschbach, S., Mata, R., Wulff, D. U. (progress)

title: Normalize responses — ar_normalize
code: ai_asso <- ar_normalize(ai_asso) #> Error in ar_normalize(ai_asso): `associations` must inherit from S3 class 'associatoR'. ai_asso <- ar_normalize(ai_asso,                         case = "original",                         punct = "all") #> Error in ar_normalize(ai_asso, case = "original", punct = "all"): `associations` must inherit from S3 class 'associatoR'.

title: Normalize responses manually — ar_normalize_manual
text: ar_normalize_manual offers interface add self-defined normalization steps responses (cues) associatoR objects.

title: Normalize responses manually — ar_normalize_manual
code: ar_normalize_manual(associations, fun, ..., protect_cues = TRUE)

title: Normalize responses manually — ar_normalize_manual
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated ar_import. fun vectorized function applied responses cues response matrix, excluding cues exist . ... additional arguments passed fun.

title: Normalize responses manually — ar_normalize_manual
text: Returns associatoR object containing list tibbles: participants tibble participants including participant id potential participant attributes. cues tibble cues including cue variable potential cue attributes. responses tibble responses including participant id, cues, responses, response level, additional response attributes.

title: Normalize responses manually — ar_normalize_manual
text: Aeschbach, S., Mata, R., Wulff, D. U. (progress)

title: Normalize responses manually — ar_normalize_manual
code: ai_asso <- ai_asso %>% ar_normalize_manual(tolower) #> Error in ar_normalize_manual(., tolower): `associations` must inherit from S3 class 'associatoR'. ai_asso <- ai_asso %>% ar_normalize_manual(trimws, which = "left") #> Error in ar_normalize_manual(., trimws, which = "left"): `associations` must inherit from S3 class 'associatoR'.

title: Set analysis targets — ar_set_targets
text: ar_set_target defines analysis targets (cues /responses).

title: Set analysis targets — ar_set_targets
code: ar_set_targets(   associations,   target_set = c("cues", "responses"),   target_manual = NULL )

title: Set analysis targets — ar_set_targets
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated ar_import. target_manual character character specifying analysis target. Overrides argument target_sets. target_sets character string vector specifying whether cues /responses targets analysis. Must one c("cues", "responses").

title: Set analysis targets — ar_set_targets
text: Returns associatoR object containing list tibbles: participants tibble participants including participant id potential participant attributes. cues tibble cues including cue variable potential cue attributes. responses tibble responses including participant id, cues, responses, response level, additional response attributes. targets tibble targets including specified analysis target

title: Set analysis targets — ar_set_targets
code: ai_asso <- ai_asso %>%   ar_define_targets(source = "cues") #> Error in ar_define_targets(., source = "cues"): could not find function "ar_define_targets"

title: Subset associations — ar_subset
text: Note subsets resets associatoR object. potential target tibble removed added using ar_import.

title: Subset associations — ar_subset
code: ai_asso <- ai_asso %>%   ar_subset(id > 10, trial = 10) #> Error in ar_subset(., id > 10, trial = 10): `associations` must inherit from S3 class 'associatoR'.

title: Write a csv file — ar_write_csv
text: ar_write_csv() joins data associatoR object one table writes table disk using readr::write_csv().

title: Write a csv file — ar_write_csv
code: ar_write_csv(associations, file, ...)

title: Write a csv file — ar_write_csv
text: associations associatoR object containing association data generated ar_import. file character write . ... optional arguments passed readr::write_csv()

title: Write a csv file — ar_write_csv
text: ar_write_csv() returns joined associations tibble invisibly.

title: Write a csv file — ar_write_csv
code: ai_asso_imported %>%   ar_set_target("responses") %>%   ar_write_csv(file = "associations.csv") #> Error in ar_set_target(., "responses"): could not find function "ar_set_target"
